intro: Psychotria marauensis, commonly known as the Marau psychotria, is a flowering plant species native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It often grows in shaded, moist environments and is found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria marauensis is also known for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
